Heading: ONIX audience codes
Note: Using a code from List 28

Heading: Proprietary
Note: As specified in <AudienceCodeTypeName>

Heading: MPAA rating
Note: Motion Picture Association of America rating applied to movies

Heading: BBFC rating
Note: British Board of Film Classification rating applied to movies

Heading: FSK rating
Note: German FSK (Freiwillige Selbstkontrolle der Filmwirtschaft) rating applied to movies

Heading: BTLF audience code
Note: French Canadian audience code list, used by BTLF for Memento

Heading: Electre audience code
Note: Audience code used by Electre (France)

Heading: ANELE Tipo
Note: Spain: educational audience and material type code of the Asociación Nacional de Editores de Libros y Material de Enseñanza

Heading: AVI
Note: Code list used to specify reading levels for children’s books, used in Flanders, and formerly in the Netherlands – see also code 18

Heading: USK rating
Note: German USK (Unterhaltungssoftware Selbstkontrolle) rating applied to video or computer games

Heading: AWS
Note: Audience code used in Flanders

Heading: Schulform
Note: Type of school: codelist maintained by VdS Bildungsmedien eV, the German association of educational media publishers. See http://www.bildungsmedien.de/service/onixlisten/schulform_onix_codelist29_value12_0408.pdf

Heading: Bundesland
Note: School region: codelist maintained by VdS Bildungsmedien eV, the German association of educational media publishers, indicating where products are licensed to be used in schools. See http://www.bildungsmedien.de/service/onixlisten/bundesland_onix_codelist29_value13_0408.pdf

Heading: Ausbildungsberuf
Note: Occupation: codelist for vocational training materials, maintained by VdS Bildungsmedien eV, the German association of educational media publishers. See http://www.bildungsmedien.de/service/onixlisten/ausbildungsberufe_onix_codelist29_value14_0408.pdf

Heading: Suomalainen kouluasteluokitus
Note: Finnish school or college level

Heading: CBG age guidance
Note: UK Publishers Association, Children’s Book Group, coded indication of intended reader age, carried on book covers

Heading: Nielsen Book audience code
Note: Audience code used in Nielsen Book Services

Heading: AVI (revised)
Note: Code list used to specify reading levels for children’s books, used in the Netherlands – see also code 09

Heading: Lexile measure
Note: Lexile measure (the Lexile measure in <AudienceCodeValue> may optionally be prefixed by the Lexile code). Examples might be ‘880L’, ‘AD0L’ or ‘HL600L’. Deprecated – use <Complexity> instead

Heading: Fry Readability score
Note: Fry readability metric based on number of sentences and syllables per 100 words. Expressed as a number from 1 to 15 in <AudienceCodeValue>. Deprecated – use <Complexity> instead

Heading: Japanese Children’s audience code
Note: Children’s audience code (対象読者), two-digit encoding of intended target readership from 0–2 years up to High School level

Heading: ONIX Adult audience rating
Note: Publisher’s rating indicating suitability for a particular adult audience, using a code from List 203. Should only be used when the ONIX Audience code indicates a general adult audience (code 01 from List 28)

Heading: Common European Framework of Reference for Language Learning (CEFR)
Note: Codes A1 to C2 indicating standardised level of language learning or teaching material, from beginner to advanced, defined by the Council of Europe (see http://www.coe.int/lang-CEFR)

Heading: Korean Publication Ethics Commission rating
Note: Rating used in Korea to control selling of books and e-books to minors. Current values are 0 (suitable for all) and 19 (only for sale to ages 19+). See http://www.kpec.or.kr/english/

Heading: IoE Book Band
Note: UK Institute of Education Book Bands for Guided Reading scheme (see http://www.ioe.ac.uk/research/4664.html). <AudienceCodeValue> is a color, eg ‘Pink A’ or ‘Copper’. Deprecated – use <Complexity> instead

Heading: FSK Lehr-/Infoprogramm
Note: Used for German videos/DVDs with educational or informative content; value for <AudienceCodeValue> must be either ‘Infoprogramm gemäß § 14 JuSchG’ or ‘Lehrprogramm gemäß § 14 JuSchG’

Heading: Intended audience language
Note: Where this is different from the language of the text of the book recorded in <Language>. <AudienceCodeValue> should be a value from List 74

Heading: PEGI rating
Note: Pan European Game Information rating used primarily for video games

Heading: Gymnasieprogram
Note: Code indicating the intended curriculum (eg Naturvetenskapsprogrammet, Estetica programmet) in Swedish higher secondary education
